title: Isolation of human and mouse myeloid-derived suppressor cells for metabolic analysis
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Isolate immune cells from mouse bone marrow
Timing: ∼1 h + 15 min/additional mouse
Bone marrow immune cells are isolated by flushing and mechanical dissociation. If the bone marrow is from tumor bearing mice, then MDSCs can then be sorted directly. However, if the bone marrow from non-tumor bearing mice is used, subsequent derivation of MDSCs must be carried out. All steps are performed in a biosafety cabinet to ensure sterility. Cell suspensions should be kept on ice for maximal cell viability and yield. See Methods video S1[href=https://www.wicell.org#mmc1] for visualization of steps 2–6.
Euthanize mice by IACUC-approved method.
Dissect away the skin to reveal the hind leg muscles.
Isolate both hind legs.
Palpate the hip socket to identify location and ensure femur is intact upon removal.
Cut along the length of the femur and tibia to remove the majority of the muscles.
Push forward on the hip socket to dislocate the femur and cut away the muscles and ligaments stabilizing the hips to detach the legs.
Isolate femur and tibia.
Dislocate the tibia from the ankle by repetitively hyperextending the joint.
Pull the muscle toward the patella to reveal the tibia.
Break off the fibula.
Dislocate the tibia from the patella by repetitively hyperextending the joint.
Place tibia in a petri dish containing sterile PBS.
Hold the patella and extend the joint to dislocate the femur from the patella.
Place the femur in petri dish with sterile PBS.
Fill a sterile 15 mL conical tube with 15 mL of sterile PBS for collection (collection tube).
Flush the bone marrow from the femur and tibia into the collection tube.
Fill a 1 mL tuberculin syringe with a 27G needle with 600 μL of sterile PBS from the collection tube.

Optional: Use surgical scissors to cut off the hip-end of the femur.
Note: Highly recommended; the needle easily clogs if this step is skipped.
Insert the sterile PBS-filled syringe into the cut end of the femur and flush out the bone marrow with 600 μL of PBS into the collection tube.
Refill the needle with 600 μL of PBS from the collection tube and flush femur an additional time.
Refill the needle with 600 μL of PBS from the collection tube.
Cut the ankle-end of the tibia.
Insert the PBS-filled syringe into the cut end of the tibia and flush with 600 μL of PBS into the collection tube.
Repeat until all bones are flushed.
Centrifuge samples at 1,500 RPM (about 505 × g) for 5 min.
Remove the supernatant.
Resuspend in 3 mL sterile ACK lysis buffer for 1 min at room temperature.
Critical: Red blood cells (RBC) lyse in culture and this is toxic to the plated bone marrow cells, reducing MDSC yield. Therefore, it is important not to look over this step.
Neutralize with 10 mL of sterile PBS.
Centrifuge samples at 1,500 RPM (about 505 × g) for 5 min.
Note: If tumor bearing mice were the source of bone marrow, continue to step 32, as MDSCs will be present in this suspension of cells.
If non-tumor bearing mice were the source of bone marrow, resuspend in 1 mL of sterile MDSC-generation media.
Quantify cells.
Note: Around 40 × 106 cells per mouse are expected. (troubleshooting 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.3]).
Continue to step 28 if not isolating human MDSCs.
    Your browser does not support HTML5 video.
  
Methods video S1. Mouse bone marrow harvest, related to steps 2–6

Bone marrow is harvested from the femur and tibia from both mouse hind legs. Majority of the muscles are cut away, which allows to easy dislocation and isolation of the bones from the remaining muscles and tendons. The bone marrow is flushed out from the bone using PBS-filled syringes. For increased yield, multiple mice of the same genotype or treatment groups may be pooled if desired and appropriate.
Isolate human peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs)
Timing: 1 h + 15 min/additional patient
Human PBMCs are isolated by density centrifugation.
Spin down blood from healthy volunteer or patient donors at 1,500 RPM (about 505 × g) for 5 min.
Place 4 mL of sterile, room temperature LymphoprepTM in a 15 mL conical tube.
Resuspend blood cell pellet in 4 mL of PBS.
Pipette the cell suspension slowly on top of the aliquoted LymphoprepTM at a 45° angle to overlay the samples without mixing.
Centrifuge at 2,000 RPM (about 898 × g) for 20 min at room temperature WITHOUT brakes to prevent disruption of the density gradient.
Carefully pipette the white middle layer containing the leukocytes into a new sterile 15 mL conical tube. Refer to Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2].
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/1654-Fig2.jpg
Figure 2. Density centrifugation isolation of PBMCs
Blood collected from donors can be centrifuged with LymphoprepTM to assist in the separation the PBMCs from other blood components.
Critical: Avoid aspirating the upper layers, which include platelets, as they can contaminate the isolated PBMCs.
Centrifuge samples at 1,500 RPM (about 505 × g) for 5 min.
Aspirate off supernatant.
Resuspend in 10 mL of sterile PBS.
Centrifuge samples at 1,500 RPM (about 505 × g) for 5 min.
Repeat steps 23 and 24 for an additional wash.
Resuspend in 1 mL of sterile MDSC-generation media.
Quantify cells.
MDSC derivation with increased β-adrenergic signal

Timing: 6 days
Isolated immune cells (from human PBMCs or non-tumor bearing mouse bone marrow) are cultured with IL-6 and GM-CSF to derive MDSCs. Here we use isoproterenol, a pan β-adrenergic agonist, to increase β-adrenergic signaling in MDSCs during this process. Investigators may use other agents that are active in vitro in a similar manner to determine whether they play a role in altering MDSC derivation or their subsequent metabolic activity.
Plate cells at 1 × 106 cells/mL density in 2 mL in a 24-well plate in MDSC-Derivation Media.
Add final concentration 10 μM isoproterenol or PBS.
Note: Isoproterenol can be substituted for the treatment specific for the experimental need of the lab. The treatment regimen will have to be optimized individually. We recommend a pilot experiment with different concentrations of the treatment.
Place cells at 37°C 5% CO2 incubator for 6 additional days. (troubleshooting 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.5]).
Replenish media and Isoproterenol every 2–3 days.
Resuspend and harvest cells into 15 mL conical.
Critical: Human PBMC-derived MDSC may adhere to the plate. Detach the adherent cells using Detachin Cell Detachment Solution according to manufacturer’s protocol[href=https://lib.store.yahoo.net/lib/yhst-131428861332406/T100100-T100106-T100110-Detachin-Manual.pdf] and pool with the isolated suspension cells. Alternative non-protease cell detachment solutions may be used. Mouse MDSCs usually do not adhere to the plate and do not need this step.
Spin down at 1,500 RPM (about 505 × g) for 5 min.
Resuspend in 1 mL of MDSC-generation media and plate in a fresh 24-well plate.
Magnetic sorting of derived MDSCs
Timing: 45 min + 10 min/Additional sample
Derived MDSCs are sorted to ensure consistent sample quality. The MDSCs are sorted magnetically rather than by fluorescent-activated cell sorting to prevent alterations in metabolic profile due to experimental handling (Llufrio et al., 2018[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib7]).
Harvest cells into sterile 5 mL round bottom polystyrene tubes with caps.

Detach adherent cells using Detachin Cell Detachment Solution.
Centrifuge sample at 1,500 RPM (about 505 × g) for 5 min.
Remove supernatant by aspiration.
Resuspend in 1 mL sterile PBS.
Quantify.
Set aside 0.1–1 × 106 cells in a new non-sterile 5 mL round bottom polystyrene tube for flow cytometric evaluation of sort efficacy.
Proceed to step 41 with cells from step 39.
Isolate MDSCs using STEMCELL magnetic isolation kit according to manufacturer’s instructions.
Note: For mouse-derived MDSC, use the EasySepTM Mouse MDSC (CD11b+GR1+) Isolation Kit (Instructions available here[href=https://cdn.stemcell.com/media/files/pis/DX22923-PIS_1_0_0.pdf]). For human PBMC-derived MDSC, use the EasySepTM HLA Chimerism Whole Blood CD33 Positive Selection Kit (Instructions available here[href=https://cdn.stemcell.com/media/files/pis/DX22166-PIS_1_0_1.pdf]).
Resuspend cells in 1 mL sterile PBS.
Quantify. (troubleshooting 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.7]).
Isolate 0.1–1 × 106 cells into a new non-sterile 5 mL round bottom polystyrene tube for flow cytometric evaluation of sort efficacy.
Proceed to step 41 with cells from step 35.
Isolate appropriate number of cells for metabolic analysis in a sterile 15 mL conical tube.
Proceed to step 58 for Fatty Acid Oxidation Analysis.
Proceed to step 79 for if Oxidative Phosphorylation Analysis without FAO analysis is desired.
Proceed to step 93 for Glycolysis Analysis.
Flow cytometric confirmation
Timing: 1 h + 10 min/Additional sample
Isolated MDSC yield and purity are confirmed by flow cytometry.
Centrifuge samples from steps 32 and 37 at 1,500 RPM (about 505 × g) for 5 min.
Resuspend in 100 μL PBS + 0.5 μL/ 1 × 106 cells FcBlock.
Stain at room temperature (20°C–25°C) for 10 min.
Add 100 μL PBS + 0.5 μL/1 × 106 cells of antibodies to each sample:
Note: Make a master mix of antibody dilutions to ensure even dispersal of antibodies across all samples.
Mouse:
table:files/protocols_protocol_1654_11.csv
Human:
table:files/protocols_protocol_1654_12.csv
Stain at room temperature (20°C–25°C) for 20 min, protected from light.

Add 1 mL of PBS to each sample to dilute excess antibodies.
Centrifuge sample at 1,500 RPM (about 505 × g) for 5 min.
Resuspend samples in 200 μL of flow buffer.
Characterize MDSCs on available flow cytometer.
Note: Use single-color controls using beads to set up appropriate compensation matrix prior to data collection.
Mouse bone marrow derived MDSC are defined as CD45+, CD11b+, Gr-1+ (Ly6G/ Ly6C).
Human PBMC derived MDSCs use: CD11b+, CD14+, CD33+.
Seahorse XF assay plate preparation
Timing: 1 h + 10 min/plate + 1 day
Before analysis, suspension cells must be adhered to the plate using Cell-Tak. Plates are usually prepared one day in advance but may be stored at 4°C for up to 2 weeks. If the number of injections is equivalent, multiple assays may be run on the same plate. Therefore, it is recommended to plan the sample layout in advance to ensure that the appropriate number of plates is coated. Plates are prepared in a biosafety cabinet to ensure sterility.
Coat XF96 Cell culture microplate with Cell-Tak.
Quickly add 20 μL Cell-Tak and Tissue Adhesive solution (see materials and equipment[href=https://www.wicell.org#materials-and-equipment]) into each well.
Cover the plate and let it sit in the hood for 20 min at room temperature (20°C–25°C).
Rinse wells with sterile, tissue culture grade water.
Remove residual solution by aspiration.
Add 100 μL of sterile, tissue culture grade water.
Remove solution by aspiration.
Cover the plate and invert to let it dry in the hood for 20 min at room temperature (20°C–25°C).
Tightly cover plate with parafilm and store at 4°C until use or for up to 2 weeks.
Sensor cartridge hydration and calibration
Timing: 20 min + 5 min/plate + 1 day incubation

For proper detection of changes in pH and/or O2 concentration, the probe tips of the sensor cartridge must be fully hydrated. Cartridges are easily hydrated overnight (minimum 4 h and maximum 72 h) in a 37°C incubator, followed by calibration in the XF Calibrant solution provided by Agilent. All steps are performed in a biosafety cabinet to ensure sterility. Detailed instructions are provided on the Agilent webpage, available here[href=https://www.agilent.com/en/product/cell-analysis/how-to-run-an-assay].
Rehydrate Agilent Seahorse sensor cartridge by submerging in sterile, tissue culture grade water.
Open a sensor cartridge pack from the Agilent Flux Pack.
Separate the utility plate and sensor cartridge and rest sensor cartridge upside down next to the utility plate.
Add 200 μL of sterile, tissue culture grade water into each well of the utility plate.
Carefully replace the sensor cartridge onto the utility plate to submerge the sensors in the water.
Place in a humidified, non-CO2, 37°C incubator overnight (usually 12–18 h).
Place 25 mL/ plate of XF Calibrant in a 50 mL conical tube and place a humidified, non-CO2, 37°C incubator overnight (usually 12–18 h).
Finish sensor cartridge rehydration by replacing the water with the pre-warmed XF Calibrant.
Remove pre-warmed XF Calibrant and sensor cartridge from incubator.
Remove sensor cartridge from utility plate and set it down upside down.
Aspirate off the water from the utility plate.
Add 200 μL of pre-warmed XF Calibrant in each well of the utility plate.
Carefully replace the sensor cartridge onto the utility plate to submerge the sensors.
Place in a humidified, non-CO2, 37°C incubator for 1 h prior to assay.
Fatty acid oxidation (FAO) assay
Timing: 1 day + 3 h

FAO rates of MDSCs are analyzed by changes in oxygen consumption rate (OCR) using the Seahorse XF Palmitate Oxidation Stress test kit. Media is changed to the substrate limiting media (with continued treatment) 24 h prior to experiment. A Mito Stress assay usually follows the etomoxir treatment. Detailed protocol for usage of the XF Palmitate Oxidation Stress Test Kit is provided by Agilent, available here[href=https://www.agilent.com/cs/library/instructionsheet/public/instructionsheet-agilent-seahorse-xf-palmitate-oxidation-stress-test-kit-quick-start-guide-cell-analysis-5994-1716en-agilent.pdf].
Centrifuge samples at 1,500 RPM (about 505 × g) for 5 min.
Resuspend in substrate limiting media (SLM) with 10 μM Isoproterenol/ PBS or desired treatment. (See materials and equipment[href=https://www.wicell.org#materials-and-equipment] section for media recipe).
Plate at 1 × 106 cells/mL in 24 well plates.
Incubate at 37°C at 5% CO2 for 24 h.
Note: See problem 5[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.9] for exposure length.
Warm Cell-Tak coated 96-well flat bottom plate from step 52 to room temperature (20°C–25°C).
Harvest cells from plates according to steps 29ai and 29aii.
Centrifuge at 1,500 RPM (about 505 × g) for 5 min.
Resuspend samples in 1 mL of 1× KHB Assay Working Solution pre-warmed to 37°C. (See materials and equipment[href=https://www.wicell.org#materials-and-equipment] section for media recipe).
Quantify.
Dilute and plate cells at 1 × 105 cells in 150 μL of 1× KHB Assay Working Solution with 10 μM Isoproterenol/ PBS or desired treatment on Cell-Tak coated 96-well flat-bottom plates from step 62.
Note: Plate at least 6 wells/sample to insure triplicate in each Palmitate-BSA vs BSA exposure conditions.
Critical: One well at each corner of the well must be left blank, containing only 180 μL of the 1× KHB Assay Working solution without any cells, for machine calibration.
Allow cells to adhere to the plate.
Incubate at room temperature (20°C–25°C) for 45 min.
Spin down plates for 5 min at 1,500 RPM (about 505 × g).
Sit in non-CO2 37°C incubator for 10 min.

Load assay compounds into injection ports on the sensor cartridge from step 57.
Resuspend provided compounds from the kit in the volume of 1× KHB working assay solution specified in the user manual[href=https://www.agilent.com/cs/library/usermanuals/public/user-manual-substrate-oxidation-stress-test-kits-cell-analysis-5994-1164en-agilent.pdf].
Prepare 2–3 mL of working solution according to the user manual to make a 10× working solution.
Load 100–200 μL of 10× working solution into the designated ports.
Optional: Add 20 μM Hoechst stain with last injection for cell density normalization.
If performing cell normalization, obtain a pre-run brightfield and fluorescence image of each well. Otherwise, this step can be skipped.
Prepare Seahorse XFe 96 Extracellular Flux Analyzer.
Design experimental template using the Standard Substrate Oxidation Stress Test Assay template and update plate map on the Wave software. Refer to the Agilent webpage[href=https://www.agilent.com/cs/library/usermanuals/public/user-manual-substrate-oxidation-stress-test-kits-cell-analysis-5994-1164en-agilent.pdf] for detailed assistance.
Note: If using a Seahorse XFe24 Analyzer, the optimal cell density (50%–90% confluency) and injection times must be optimized for the larger well surface area and volume. There is a default 2-minute wait step requirement prior to each measurement.
3 measurements of baseline oxygen consumption rate. (OCRbaseline).
Inject 100 μM etomoxir (ETX).
5 OCR measurements at maximal exogenous FAO inhibition. (OCR+ETX).
Inject 2 mM Oligomycin.
3 OCR measurements.
Inject 1 mM carbonyl cyanide 4-(trifluoromethoxy)phenylhydrazone (FCCP).
3 OCR measurements.
Inject 1 mM Rotenone and 1 mM Antimycin A.
3 OCR measurements.
Run calibration.
Click “Run”.
Insert sensor cartridge from step 69 when prompted.
Click “I’m Ready”.
Run Calibration.
Add 30 μL of Palmitate-BSA (1 mM Palmitate conjugated to 0.17 mM BSA) or BSA (0.17 mM) to appropriate sample wells.
Run samples on Seahorse XFe 96 Extracellular Flux Analyzer.
Click “Open tray” and load cell plate without the lid.
Click “Load Cell Plate” to run the assay.

If performing cell normalization, normalize the data to cell count. If not, this step can be skipped.
Obtain post-run brightfield and fluorescence image of each well.
Calculate each well’s live cell count.
Click “Normalize”.
Enter live cell count into the Normalization grid.
Set Normalization Unit as Cells.
Click “Apply”.
Export data from the Wave software into GraphPad Prism format.
Note: Data may be graphed using the default Wave software as well.
Graph the individual OCR measurements for each treatment condition.
Calculate the average OCR of the sample triplicates per treatment condition.
Use the averages to calculate the FAO contribution, defined as OCRbaseline - OCR+ETX. (troubleshooting 5[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.9]).
Oxidative phosphorylation (OxPhos) assay
Timing: 3 h
OxPhos levels of MDSCs are measured by oxygen consumption rate after priming in OCR media without CO2. Detailed protocol for usage of the Mito Stress Test Kit is provided by Agilent, available here[href=https://www.agilent.com/cs/library/usermanuals/public/XF_Cell_Mito_Stress_Test_Kit_User_Guide.pdf].
Warm Cell-Tak coated 96-well flat bottom plate from step 52 to room temperature (20°C–25°C).
Centrifuge samples at 1,500 RPM (about 505 × g) for 5 min.
Resuspend cells in OCR medium pre-warmed to 37°C. (See materials and equipment[href=https://www.wicell.org#materials-and-equipment] section for media recipe).
Plate at 1 × 105 cells in 180 μL in Cell-Tak coated 96-well flat-bottom plates from step 79.
Note: Plate each experimental condition in triplicate.
Critical: One well at each corner of the well must be left blank, containing only 180 μL of the OCR medium, for machine calibration.
Allow cells to adhere to the plate.
Incubate at room temperature (20°C–25°C) for 45 min.
Spin down plates for 5 min at 1,500 RPM (about 505 × g).
Sit in non-CO2 37°C incubator for 10 min.
Load assay compounds into injection ports on the sensor cartridge from step 57.

Resuspend provided compounds from the kit in the volume of OCR medium specified in the user manual.[href=https://www.agilent.com/cs/library/usermanuals/public/XF_Cell_Mito_Stress_Test_Kit_User_Guide.pdf]
Prepare 2–3 mL of working solution according to the user manual to make a 10× working solution.
Load 100–200 μL of 10× working solution into the designated ports.
Optional: Add 20 μM Hoechst stain with last injection for cell density normalization.
If performing cell normalization, obtain a pre-run brightfield and fluorescence image of each well. Otherwise, this step can be skipped.
Prepare Seahorse XFe 96 Extracellular Flux Analyzer.
Design experimental template and update plate map on the Wave software. Refer to the Agilent webpage[href=https://www.agilent.com/cs/library/usermanuals/public/XF_Cell_Mito_Stress_Test_Kit_User_Guide.pdf] for detailed assistance.
Note: If using a Seahorse XFe24 Analyzer, the optimal cell density (50%–90% confluency) and injection times must be optimized for the larger well surface area and volume. There is a default 2-minute wait step requirement prior to each measurement.
Obtain 3 measurements of baseline oxygen consumption rate. (OCRbasal).
Inject 2 mM Oligomycin to inhibit mitochondrial complex V.
Obtain 3 OCR measurements. (OCR+Oligomycin).
Inject 1 mM carbonyl cyanide 4-(trifluoromethoxy)phenylhydrazone (FCCP) to induce maximal respiration.
Obtain 3 OCR measurements. (OCR+FCCP).
Inject 1 mM Rotenone and 1 mM Antimycin A to inhibit the electron transport chain.
Obtain 3 OCR measurements. (OCR+Antimycin A/Rotenone).
Run calibration.
Click “Run”.
Insert sensor cartridge from step 84 when prompted.
Click “I’m Ready”.
Run Calibration.
Run samples on Seahorse XFe 96 Extracellular Flux Analyzer.
Click “Open tray” and load cell plate without the lid.
Click “Load Cell Plate” to run the assay.
If performing cell normalization, normalize the data to cell count. If not, this step can be skipped.
Obtain post-run brightfield and fluorescence image of each well.
Calculate each well’s live cell count.
Click “Normalize”.
Enter live cell count into the Normalization grid.
Set Normalization Unit as Cells.
Click “Apply”.

Export data from the Wave software into GraphPad Prism format.
Note: Data may be graphed using the default Wave software as well.
Graph the individual OCR measurements for each treatment condition.
Calculate the average OCR of the sample triplicates per treatment condition.
Using the average OCR, calculate ATP Production, defined as OCRbasal - OCR+Oligomycin, and Maximal Respiratory Capacity, defined as OCR+FCCP - OCR+Antimycin A/Rotenone.
Glycolysis assay
Timing: 3 h
Glycolysis levels in MDSCs are measured by extracellular acidification rate. Detailed protocol for the usage of the XF Glycolysis Stress Test kit is provided by Agilent, available here[href=https://www.agilent.com/cs/library/usermanuals/public/XF_Glycolysis_Stress_Test_Kit_User_Guide.pdf].
Warm Cell-Tak coated 96-well flat bottom plate from step 52 to room temperature (20°C–25°C).
Centrifuge samples at 1,500 RPM (about 505 × g) for 5 min.
Resuspend cells in ECAR medium pre-warmed to 37°C. (See materials and equipment[href=https://www.wicell.org#materials-and-equipment] section for media recipe).
Plate at 1 × 105 cells in 180 μL in Cell-Tak coated 96-well flat-bottom plates from step 93.
Note: Plate each experimental condition in triplicate.
Critical: One well at each corner of the well must be left blank, containing only 180 μL of the ECAR medium, for machine calibration.
Allow cells to adhere to the plate.
Incubate at room temperature for 45 min.
Spin down plates for 5 min at 1,500 RPM (about 505 × g).
Sit in non-CO2 37°C incubator for 10 min.
Load assay compounds into injection ports on the sensor cartridge from step 57.
Resuspend provided compounds from the kit in the volume of ECAR medium specified in the user manual[href=https://www.agilent.com/cs/library/usermanuals/public/XF_Glycolysis_Stress_Test_Kit_User_Guide.pdf].
Prepare 2–3 mL of working solution according to the user manual to make a 10× working solution.
Load 100–200 μL of 10× working solution into the designated ports.
Optional: Add 20 μM Hoechst stain with last injection for cell density normalization.

If performing cell normalization, obtain a pre-run brightfield and fluorescence image of each well. Otherwise, this step can be skipped.
Prepare Seahorse XFe 96 Extracellular Flux Analyzer.
Design experimental template and update plate map on the Wave software. Refer to the Agilent webpage[href=https://www.agilent.com/cs/library/usermanuals/public/XF_Glycolysis_Stress_Test_Kit_User_Guide.pdf] for detailed assistance.
Note: If using a Seahorse XFe24 Analyzer, the optimal cell density (50%–90% confluency) and injection times must be optimized for the larger well surface area and volume. There is a default 2-minute wait step requirement prior to each measurement.
Obtain 3 measurements of non-glycolytic extracellular acidification rate (ECAR). (ECARnon-glycolytic).
Inject 10 mM Glucose to induce glycolysis.
Obtain 3 ECAR measurements. (ECAR+glucose).
Inject 2 mM Oligomycin to inhibit mitochondrial complex V and induce maximal glycolysis.
Obtain 3 ECAR measurements. (ECAR+Oligomycin).
Inject 100 mM 2-Deoxy-glucose (2-DG) to inhibit glycolysis.
Obtain 3 ECAR measurements (ECAR+2-DG).
Run calibration.
Click “Run”.
Insert sensor cartridge from step 98 when prompted.
Click “I’m Ready”.
Run Calibration.
Run samples on Seahorse XFe 96 Extracellular Flux Analyzer.
Click “Open tray” and load cell plate without the lid.
Click “Load Cell Plate” to run the assay.
If performing cell normalization, normalize the data to cell count. If not, this step can be skipped.
Obtain post-run brightfield and fluorescence image of each well.
Calculate each well’s live cell count.
Click “Normalize”.
Enter live cell count into the Normalization grid.
Set Normalization Unit as Cells.
Click “Apply”.
Export data from the Wave software into GraphPad Prism format.
Note: Data may be graphed using the default Wave software as well.
Graph the individual ECAR measurements for each treatment condition.
Calculate the average ECAR of the sample triplicates per treatment condition.
Using the average ECAR, calculate rate of glycolysis, defined as ECAR+glucose – ECARnon-glycolytic, and glycolytic capacity, defined as ECAR+Oligomycin - ECAR+2-DG.
